applicability_reasoning: This regulation applies to the document for several key reasons: 1) The document is a pension life cover scheme rules document issued by AIB life, which is explicitly stated to be regulated by the Central Bank of Ireland (as noted in the footer 'Saol Assurance d.a.c., trading as AIB life, is regulated by the Central Bank of Ireland'). 2) The document outlines consumer-facing financial products and services, specifically pension and life cover schemes, which fall under the consumer protection mandate of the Central Bank. 3) The document contains provisions that directly impact consumers' rights and protections, including benefit payments, trustee duties, and scheme administration. 4) The document includes sections on consumer communication and contact (Section 6) which would be subject to consumer protection regulations. Since AIB life is a regulated entity providing regulated financial services to consumers, any failure to comply with the provisions outlined in this document would constitute a prescribed contravention under Regulation 420 of the Consumer Protection Regulations.
regulation_title: Failure to comply with these Regulations
regulation_text: 420. A failure by a regulated entity to comply with any requirement or obligation imposed pursuant to these Regulations is a prescribed contravention for the purpose of the administrative sanctions procedure under Part IIIC of the Act of 1942 and may be subject to enforcement action and the imposition of administrative sanctions by the Bank in accordance with that Part.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
